bibl.title: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, March 31, 1921

div1.p: Hanson writes about the vaccine being sent to Peru. He is concerned about funding.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, March 31, 1921
div1.opener:
DIRECCION
DE LA
CAMPAÑA SANITARIA
CONTRA LA FIEBRE AMARILLA
EN LOS DEPARTAMENTOS DEL NORTE
---
OFICINA CENTRAL
---
Reports
Chiclayo, Peru. March 31, 1921.
Dr. H.R. Carter,
Washington, D.C.
My Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am enclosing a letter and a telegram which came addressed
to you. I have taken the liberty to open them to see if there were some matters
which might need immediate attention.

The one from Panama about the vaccine is a matter in which Mr. Bonzi
is very much interested, because he feels that Dr. Quiroz was decidedly neglige-
nt in that he did not personally attend to the receipt of the vaccine. I have
questioned Valencia about the matter, and he says that they received a telegram
(cable) from Panama that vaccine was coming directed to Quiroz, This message
came in English, and Mr. Bonzi translated for them, who recommended urgently a
taht they observe all precautions. I have written the Salubridad about this a
matter and enclose copy for your information.

We are having a great deal of worry about funds as you will notice
by the copies of the following Radiograms. These were sent when I asked the
Prefecto to turn over the funds corresponding to the “secunda quincena”, when
he stated that there were no funds on hand for the campaign.
RADIOGRAMA OFICIAL # 3.
Salubridad ---- Lima. Chiclayo 22 de marzo.

Aduana Eten manifesta no recibido orden Tesoro entregar
subvencion asignada Resolucion 4 presente atendo gastos Campana. Sirvase
gestionar ergentmente impartase mencionado order.
HANSON.
RADIOGRAMA OFICIAL # 4.
Salubridad Lima, Chiclayo 29 de marzo de 1921.

Sirvase contestar radiograma fecha 22 actual. Ahora no hay
fondos continuar Campana.
HANSON.

To the second message we finally received a reply that he was takig
the matter up with the Treasurer. This was so indefinite that I sent the follow-
ing:
Radiogram Oficial # 5.
Direccion Tesoro ..... Lima. March 31, '21.

Hasta hoy Teserero Fiscal no ha recibido ordenes abonar gastos Cam-
pana Sanitaria. He pagado todo con fondos Rockefeller y estoy sin fondos con-
tinuar y pagar peones Semana. Dirijome Presidente mismo sentido.
HANSON.
Radiograma Oficial # 6. Chiclayo March 31, 1921.

President Leguia....Lima.
Received no funds from Aduana. All expenses since arrival paid with
Rockefeller funds. Nothing left to continue with.
HANSON.

This I hope will bring some results. I have just received the circu-
lar from the Internation Health Board giving the form of their financial parti-
cipation. We will need to reimburse this money and commence spending according
to their idea of the budget. I hope Rose will write me explaining his idea a
little further.

closer.seg:
P. S.
I have recovered your
sweater and have it in
my room.
H. H.
